meanings.definition: A device used to demagnetize a magnetic tape or disk.
meanings.sent1: The degausser removed the unwanted magnetic fields from the tape.
meanings.sent2: I need to use the degausser to erase the data on this old disk.
meanings.sent3: The degausser decided to take a break after demagnetizing so many tapes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a degausser, wiping away any negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The degausser hummed softly as it worked its magic on the tapes.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that degausses.
meanings.sent1: The skilled degausser quickly erased the data from the disk.
meanings.sent2: We hired a professional degausser to help us with the magnetic tapes.
meanings.sent3: The little robot claimed to be a degausser, but it just liked playing with magnets.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter acted like a degausser, clearing the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The degausser's precision was unmatched when it came to demagnetizing devices.

meanings.definition: To demagnetize (a magnetic tape or disk) using a degausser.
meanings.sent1: I will degausser the tape before recording new data on it.
meanings.sent2: Remember to degausser the disk before reusing it.
meanings.sent3: He tried to degausser the tape with a magnet, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to degausser the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The technician carefully degaussed the tape to ensure all data was erased.
